data.name: 24 Karat Gold Lager
data.description: A German Helles, or a new world golden lager, lightly hopped with German noble hops that create a delicious balanced malty flavor with a fine lingering mild hop finish

style.name: Münchner (Munich)-Style Helles
style.description: This beer should be perceived as having low bitterness. It is a medium-bodied, malt-emphasized beer with malt character often balanced with low levels of yeast produced sulfur compounds (character). Certain renditions of this beer style have  a perceivable level of hop flavor (note: hop flavor does not imply hop bitterness) and character but it is essentially balanced with malt character to retain its style identity. Malt character is sometimes bread-like yet always reminiscent of freshly and very lightly toasted malted barley. There should not be any caramel character. Color is light straw to golden. Fruity esters and diacetyl should not be perceived. There should be no chill haze.

breweries.name: Last Frontier Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The Last Frontier Brewery is a family run business, by Alaskans for Alaskans and visitors to Alaska.

Our brewery offers beers that have world-class flavor, from the lightest roasted malt to the aromatic bouquet of fine hops. These recipes that we have developed involve a very strict process that has to be meticulously monitored step by step to ensure the highest quality available. We also incorporate our brews into many items on our menu.

breweries.name: Familienbrauerei Jacob
breweries.description:
In 1738 the workers of the smelting work in Bodenwöhr requested permission from Karl Albrecht, Elector of Bavaria, to establish a brewhouse so that they would no longer need to import the brews of somewhat inferior quality from nearby towns.
Twenty years later, in 1758, the first master brewer, Peter Still, ultimately was allowed to begin his work beside the Hammersee.
In 1884, Johann Baptist Jacob (the great-grandfather of present-day owner Marcus Jacob) acquired the company. The two generations of the Jacob family that followed upheld his pioneering spirit and iron will to maintain the business to the benefit of quality and the employees.

Reaping the rewards: Jacob wheat beer has been awarded the gold seal by German Agricultural Society (DLG) every year since 1994.

breweries.description: The Bier Brewery and Taproom is excited to be one of the newest breweries in Indiana.  We are committed to the highest quality and best tasting bier in Indianapolis.  Our small size allows BIER to have the utmost control over the many different variables that go into brewing a batch of beer.

data.name: Amber
data.description:
Amber is a Munich style lager brewed with crystal malt and Perle hops. It has a smooth, malty, slightly caramel flavor and a rich amber color. Abita Amber was the first beer offered by the brewery and continues to be our leading seller. Amber is Abita’s most versatile beer for pairing with food. It has been voted "best beer" in numerous New Orleans reader polls and is used frequently in recipes of great Louisiana chefs.

Because of its smooth, malty flavor, try it with smoked sausages, Louisiana boudin, or even with caviar. It’s great with crawfish and Cajun food. You might also enjoy it paired with a spicy gumbo or tomato-based pasta sauce. It also goes well also with fried catfish dipped in a tart, lemony tartar sauce. Parmesan, Pecorino and Romano cheeses are good pairings with Abita Amber.

breweries.name: Abita Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Founded in 1986, the Abita Brewing Company is nestled in the piney woods 30 miles north of New Orleans.

In its first year, the brewery produced 1,500 barrels of beer. We had no idea what we started. Customers loved our beer! By 1994, we outgrew the original site (now our 100-seat brew pub) and moved up the road to a larger facility to keep up with demand.


We brew over 160,000 barrels of beer and 10,000 barrels of root beer in our state-of-the-art brewing facility. Our lagers and ales are brewed in small batches, hand-crafted by a team of dedicated workers with only the highest ideals of quality. This pride, along with our brewing process, is what creates our great brews.

We are privately owned and operated by local shareholders, many who have been with us since day one.

Abita uses only the finest ingredients – British and North American malted barley, German and American yeast strains, Pacific Northwest hops and the pure artesian water of Abita Springs.

In Abita Springs, we are blessed with the purest of water. Drawn from our deep wells, our pristine water is not altered in any way.

Abita Beer has no preservatives, additives or stabilizers and is cold filtered. The result is beer that is the finest and freshest tasting as proven by our loyal customers and great chefs of the south who use Abita Beer in their recipes.

It is a medium-bodied, malt-emphasized beer with malt character often balanced with low levels of yeast produced sulfur compounds (character). Certain renditions of this beer style have  a perceivable level of hop flavor (note: hop flavor does not imply hop bitterness) and character but it is essentially balanced with malt character to retain its style identity. breweries.name: Coal Creek TAP
breweries.description: Coal Creek turned 21, so naturally, we opened a nano-brewery! Visit us at 108 Grand Ave. located right next door to the downtown Coal Creek Coffee shop. Currently, we have 13 different brews on tap, ensuring that everyone will find something to love. Every beer is hand-crafted on site by owner and brew-master, John Guerin, a long-time business owner and Laramie entrepreneur. At Coal Creek TAP we encourage you to break out of your beer comfort zone and experience something new. And, if you're not ready to commit to a pint, we offer 5oz. and 10oz. pours as well as flights of our beers. We've got something for everyone's palate: a light, fruity and refreshing pilsner; a rich and creamy smoked porter, a variety of pale ales and IPA's, and big, bright and spicy Belgians!

data.name: Atlas Fest Bier
data.description: Atlas Fest Bier is our seasonal offering of a traditional German-style Spezial Helles brewed only for Fall. Ours will be released just in time for the 2011 H St. Festival. Fermented at 58-60°F for 2 weeks and then lagered for 5 weeks - progressively reducing the temperature by 2°F each day until we reach our terminal temperaure of 36°F. Atlas Fest Bier is brewed with American Brewers 2 row Pale malt, Munich malt and Aromatic malt. It was hopped with American grown German Perle to achieve a light, highly drinkable 17 IBU. There are also bready, biscuty and sweet malt notes in the aroma.

breweries.name: DC Brau Brewing Company
breweries.description: The fact that D.C. has become a world-class beer town is undeniable. The choices available to the local beer nerdery are staggering and ever expanding. The neighborhood corner stores continue to add microbrews to their stock and it seems that a dynamite draft selection is essential to any new bar that opens. Restaurants regularly hold beer dinners featuring multi-course food and beer pairings and for seven days in the spring, during DC Beer Week, the number of beer-themed events can make the head spin. At a handful of downtown brewpubs the beer enthusiast can sample a variety of house made brews. What D.C. has not had in over 60 years, however, is a brewery whose product is available in local stores and on tap outside of its site of production.

breweries.name: Alpine Beer Company
breweries.description:
Alpine Beer Company opened its doors in the fall of 2002. Years before, an interest in craft brewing developed into an actual goal for the future. There were years of home brew competitions, brew science classes, and extended beer runs thinly disguised as vacations. 
The brewery went through an expansion starting in late 2008 and became operational in mid 2009. Four double sized fermentors were installed in an old garage behind the current brewery. A cold box was erected adjacent to the garage and a bottling machine with a nice labeler are housed there too. There is a small barrel shed on the shady, north side of the garage.

data.name: Ayinger Lager Hell
data.description:
Ayinger Lager Hell is the typical every day drink in Bavaria. Together with wheat beer this Muenchener Hell style is the most famous beer style in the Bavarian south. 

As people in Bavaria are very demanding as far as their daily drink is concerned the brewers are very aware of the necessity to brew a yellow-golden beer with a light malt taste. It is crisp, smooth and mellow. A perfectly balanced taste and aroma. 

Ayinger Lager Hell is often used for cooking and it can be paired with many typical Bavarian dishes like for example beef, pork and cold meat with radish and Brez’n.

breweries.name: Brauerei Ayinger
breweries.description:
The Ayinger Brewery (pronounced "eye-ing-gr"; German: Brauerei Aying) is a medium-sized German brewery located in Aying, Bavaria, about 25 km from Munich. Approximately 10% of Ayinger beers are exported, mainly to Italy, the United States, and the rest of Europe. Ayinger beers have been frequent award winners in international beer competitions.

For some years, a range of beer was brewed under the Ayingerbrau name by Samuel Smith's Brewery in Tadcaster, United Kingdom. Although the Ayinger logo was used, the recipes and range were different from those of the Ayinger Brewery. The arrangement ended in spring 2006, at which point Samuel Smith's rebranded the beers. Distribution of the Ayinger range of beer followed that summer. Because the Oktoberfest in Munich does not allow breweries outside its city limits to participate, Ayinger Brewery organizes many smaller festivals in the countryside around Munich.

data.name: Barfüßer "Blonde"
data.description: Auch wenn die Barfüßer Blonde gerne als Halbe ausgeschenkt wird, ist sie eine ganz runde Sache. Trotz ihres kühlen Auftritts schaut sie herrlich goldig aus. Ob nach einem langen Arbeitstag oder am wohlverdienten Wochenende, ihre erfrischende Art zaubert stets ein Lächeln auf die Gesichter.

breweries.name: Artisan's Brewery & Italian Grill
breweries.description:
At Artisan's Brewery, "Beer is Art".
Our Brewmaster Dave Hoffman hand selects hops and malted barley from only quality suppliers.

All of our beers are handcrafted in the on premise Brewery, made from our Brewmaster’s own recipes.

We proudly brew a variety of traditional beer styles and more distinctive specialty ales and lagers.

data.name: Bat Outta Helles
data.description: Traditional Helles-style lager—Munich’s initial answer to Bohemian Pils—very pale, with significant sweet malt flavor and drying hop finish.  The base beer for this year’s Funkiest of Show, Nacho Sancho Ancho.

breweries.name: Freetail Brewing Company
breweries.description:
#1 rated brewpub in Texas (rated by BeerAdvocate.com) located at NW Military Highway and Loop 1604. Winner of the San Antonio Express-News 2009 Critics Choice and 2010 Silver Medalist for "Best Place for a Cold Beer" & San Antonio Magazine's Best of the City "Best Place for a Beer" for two years running (2009, 2010).  Winner of Draft Magazine "Top 25 Beers of 2010" in the smoked beer category for "Rubio Fumando".

Named after the official Texas flying mammal, the Mexican Free-tail Bat, Freetail opened its doors Thanksgiving Weekend 2008 and has been cranking out highly rated, fresh, off-the-wall brews ever since.

We feature fresh craft brews from in house and around the state of Texas in addition to artisan pizzas, sandwiches, salads, appetizers and desserts made from the highest quality ingredients.

Join the friendliest staff in town for happy hour M 4-7 andW-F 3-7 with $5 apps and $1 off beer and wine!  Or try us on Tuesdays for Pint Night where Freetail pints are $2.50 all day, or Mondays for $10 pitchers.  Enjoy Freetail brews and guest beer from microbreweries around the state in our spacious open seating, or large outdoor patio with bar service, and catch the game on one of our nine high-definition TV's and two 100"+ screens.free_wi_fi_spot_copy.gif  Free WiFi for customers.

breweries.name: Flossmoor Station Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Is it a family restaurant, or a world-renowned brewery? Flossmoor Station has no identity crisis — it carries both titles with panache! Named “Best Brewery in Chicago” by Chicago Magazine (August 2002), Flossmoor Station features a gleaming glass-enclosed brewery where guests can watch how its fine handcrafted beers are made. (Tours are available upon request). The brewery has won dozens of local, national and international brewing industry honors in only ten years – a distinction not lost on micro-brew aficionados. 

Some of its more notable awards include being named Best Small Brewpub and Best Small Brewpub Brewer in America at the 2006 Great American Beer FestivalTM and winning gold, silver and bronze medals. Gold and silver medals were also awarded at the 2006 World Beer Cup. In addition, Flossmoor Station Brewery consistently receives top honors and recognition from the Real Ale Festival, Festival of Barrel Aged Beers and the Chicago Beer Society.

Produced entirely on-site, Flossmoor Station Brewing Company’s beers are handcrafted from the finest ingredients available, brewed in small batches with close attention to detail, and transferred to storage tanks in Flossmoor Station’s beer cellar until its flavor is at its peak. When a customer orders a pint of beer 
upstairs at the massive oak bar, that lucky patron is assured of getting the freshest pint of brew money can buy. 

Eight different beers round out the selection of “The Great Eight House Beers” which are offered on a regular basis at Flossmoor Station. In addition, beer enthusiasts look forward to the “Brewmaster’s Specials” which are offered in limited batches, including some seasonal favorites. Many of the brewery’s awards have gone to these more unique concoctions which have stood up to the best beers in the world at international competitions.

data.name: Bavarian Helles
data.description: A crisp and refreshing golden blonde lager from the Bavarian region of Germany. With mild hop bitterness and light malty body, this lager is a palate pleaser.

Come on in and enjoy a pint or two and take a growler home with you to share with your friends and family

Welcome to Rapp Brewing Company!
Home of hand crafted small batch artisanal Ales and Lagers.
Our goal is to bring you the finest examples of traditional beer styles using the best available ingredients.
We also offer you intriguing variations of traditional styles as well as exploring styles from past ages.
We use our creativity in the art of brewing and invite you to join us in that adventure.

breweries.name: Allgäuer Brauhaus AG Kempten
breweries.description: The Allgäuer Brauhaus AG is a traditional, today Radeberger group owned specialty brewery from the Allgäu region with headquarters in Kempten. The company brews a wide range of specialty beers.

data.name: Beer Geek Helles
data.description: Beer Geek Helles is a collaboration between Jack’s Abby Craft Lagers and New England Brewing Co. The beer makes use of custom malts by Stone Path Malt, and uses Nelson Sauvin and Hallertau Blanc hops. The brew itself involved a double decoction mash procedure, a traditional German technique that involves the repeated cooking of the wort.

breweries.name: Jack's Abby Brewing
breweries.description: Jack's Abby Brewing was formally founded in January of 2011 by three brothers, Jack, Eric and Sam Hendler, who grew up in a family business. The ideas behind it, however, date back over ten years to when Jack was still in college experimenting with home brews. After graduating, Jack became the head brewer of one of the largest brewpubs in the eastern US. He earned joint diplomas in Brewing Technology from Siebel Institute of Chicago and Doemans Academy of Munich. Currently he is a member of the Master Brewers Association.

data.name: Big Woody
data.description: A light and refreshing malty lager brewed in the Munich style and tradition.

style.name: Münchner (Munich)-Style Helles
style.description: This beer should be perceived as having low bitterness. It is a medium-bodied, malt-emphasized beer with malt character often balanced with low levels of yeast produced sulfur compounds (character). Certain renditions of this beer style have  a perceivable level of hop flavor (note: hop flavor does not imply hop bitterness) and character but it is essentially balanced with malt character to retain its style identity. Malt character is sometimes bread-like yet always reminiscent of freshly and very lightly toasted malted barley. There should not be any caramel character. Color is light straw to golden. Fruity esters and diacetyl should not be perceived. There should be no chill haze.

breweries.name: The Brew Kettle, Taproom and Smokehouse
breweries.description: The BREW Kettle opened its doors in the fall of 1995 as Ohio's First Brew-On-Premise Microbrewery.  From that first day it has been our goal to provide our customers with the guidance, equipment and the freshest ingredients to produce quality, hand-crafted beers in an environment that is professional, safe and fun.  Fourteen years and 35,000 batches later, we are still committed to our customers' needs and desires. We invite you to visit our brewery to have a "look-see", visit with our expert brewing staff, or try brewing a batch from our "tried-and-true" recipe list.  we guarantee you'll be hooked!

data.name: Bikini Blonde Lager
data.description: Our flagship Munich-Style Helles is brewed with Pilsner, Light Munich and a touch of Crystal malts for a differentiating color and sweetness. Complimented by the hop aroma and low bitterness provided by the floral and slightly spicy Sterling and Saaz hops. The result is a clean, crisp and flavorful lager perfect for a sunny Maui day.

breweries.name: Maui Brewing Co.
breweries.description: Maui Brewing Co., with a brewpub in Kahana and production brewery in Kihei, has built a reputation for creating handcrafted beers brewed using the finest natural ingredients.  We have become one of the area's most popular dining locations and are Hawaii's largest craft brewery.  Our menu offers a broad selection of fine foods to satisfy any palate.

locations.name: Maui Brewing Co.
locations.hoursOfOperation: 11am-10pm every day

data.name: Blonde Lager
data.description: Rahr's Blonde Lager was the first beer to come out of Rahr & Sons Brewing Company. It is a medium-bodied traditional Munich Helles-style pale lager that features a rounded maltiness without being too heavy. And like every proud Texan, it has a good head, is pleasant – but not overly sweet.
data.foodPairings:
Food Pairings: Experts like to pair this beer with seafood and pork. Now, the folks at Rahr & Sons aren’t the kind to argue with experts, but we think our Blonde Lager also tastes pretty darn good with a pile of hot wings after a long day in the brewhouse.

Cheese Pairings: Gouda, Swiss

breweries.name: Rahr & Sons Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The story of Rahr & Sons Brewing Co. really starts when Fritz Rahr graduated from Texas Christian University. Fortunately for beer lovers in North Texas, Fritz not only fell in love with Fort Worth, but also fell in love with his future wife here. And in another fortuitous twist for all of us, Fritz’s wife, Erin, gave him the thumbs up when he announced that he would like to carry on the Rahr family tradition of brewing.

Fritz and Erin founded Rahr & Sons Brewing Co. in the fall of 2004. In five years, the brewery has more than doubled its brewing capacity - from 2,000 barrels per year to over 5,000 barrels per year and has won fifteen nationally-recognized awards, including a Bronze Medal at the 2008 World Beer Cup for Bucking Bock and 2009 National Grand Champion from the United States Beer Tasting Championships for Iron Thistle.

breweries.name: Camden Town Brewery
breweries.description: Welcome to Camden Town Brewery. London now has it's very own craft beer and as the name suggests, it's being brewed in Camden. Using only the freshest ingredients and no brain aching chemicals, we'll be brewing lager, wheat beer and pale ale. The best city in the world deserves the best beer and now it's right in your backyard.

breweries.name: Cape May Brewing Company
breweries.description: We are Cape May County's first and only microbrewery serving South Jersey. Our beers are made in small batches and are hand crafted with the finest ingredients. We are just a small team, in a small warehouse, who share the same vision to make the finest quality beer possible.

data.name: CarlBock (Helles)
data.description: What more can be said about this beer that hasn't already been tweeted about?  Well, if you've been living on Mars then you don't know that this beer is Named after the Mighty Carl, Patron Saint of many STL bars, and will only be on planet Earth for a short time.  The beer itself was brewed as a HellesBock which is simply a lighter colored, hoppyish-lager that is brewed to a stronger strength (Bock).  The Man himself is much harder to describe.  Some would say Charming.  Some would say Handsome and Debonair.  Some would even claim him to be Charitable, Friendly and Trustworthy.  Who are these people?  #thanksforpaintingandtuckpointingourentirebuildingcarl.

breweries.name: Civil Life Brewing Company
breweries.description:
We hold these truths to be self-evident: that all men are created equal, with certain unalienable Rights, that among these are Life, Liberty, and the Pursuit of fine crafted ales. 

We are a local craft brewery situated in the great Tower Grove South neighborhood. We currently have 8 beers on draft a British Bitter, English Best, American Brown, German Wheat, Scottish Ale, Vienna Lager, Black Lager, Munich Dunkel Lager. We built a very traditional pub inside of an old warehouse. Best yet, our beers can be found around town. Head to our web-site at www.thecivillife.com for a listing. Hope you can enjoy a pint sometime soon and check us out. Cheers!

breweries.name: Susquehanna Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Susquehanna Brewing Company delivers prosperity and enjoyment to our Northeastern Pennsylvania (NEPA) customers and consumers through our quality, craft beers made locally in an environmentally responsible fashion.

We’re beer people. It’s in our blood. 6th generation and going strong. Back before it was hip to brew beer, our grandfathers’ grandfathers spent time crafting the perfect, drinkable beer right here in northeastern Pennsylvania. The beer brewing torch has been passed down, and now it’s our turn. To make the kind of beer you can enjoy all day long, if you’re so inclined. And we have to admit, someti...See More

breweries.name: Weeping Radish Farm Brewery
breweries.description:
The Weeping Radish is the Oldest Microbrewery in North Carolina. 25 years ago it was illegal for breweries to sell their own beer directly to consumers; they had to go through a distributor. This made it impossible for microbreweries or small brewpubs to exist. In 1985 Uli Bennewitz went to his local senator and together they passed a bill allowing microbreweries to sell their own beer on site. A year later on the July 4th, 1986 the Weeping Radish Brewery opened for business. 
 
Raised in a small village in Bavaria, Uli was determined to bring the high quality beer he was used to across the ocean to North Carolina. A Master Brewer came over from Germany and brewed the first batches of Corolla Gold, Fest, and Black Radish. Strictly adhering to the Reinheitsgebot Purity Law of 1516, all Weeping Radish beers are brewed using hops, malt, yeast and water â€“ no additives, chemicals or preservatives. 
 
Our beer list has expanded over the years and currently on draft in the pub we have the OBX KÃ¶lsch, IPA 25, and Radler as well as our original Corolla Gold, Fest and Black Radish. And for those of you with a sweet tooth we make a fantastic Root Beer!

data.name: Cultivator
data.description: Emerging from springtime’s fertile ground, Cultivator celebrates the start of hop-growing season as sprawling fields of hop rhizomes climb and tether to hop bines. This spring bock delivers hints of toasted grains, fresh baked bread and delicate floral hops.

style.name: Münchner (Munich)-Style Helles
style.description: This beer should be perceived as having low bitterness. It is a medium-bodied, malt-emphasized beer with malt character often balanced with low levels of yeast produced sulfur compounds (character). Certain renditions of this beer style have  a perceivable level of hop flavor (note: hop flavor does not imply hop bitterness) and character but it is essentially balanced with malt character to retain its style identity. Malt character is sometimes bread-like yet always reminiscent of freshly and very lightly toasted malted barley. There should not be any caramel character. Color is light straw to golden. Fruity esters and diacetyl should not be perceived. There should be no chill haze.

breweries.name: Tröegs Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Tröegs Brewing Company was established in 1997 by brothers Chris and John Trogner. Since then, the Central PA natives have been handcrafting world-class beers that blend traditional brewing techniques with the innovation and eclecticism of the American craft brewing movement. Today, the Hershey, PA-based brewery produces six year-round beers (Hopback Amber Ale, Troegenator Double Bock, JavaHead Stout, Tröegs Pale Ale, DreamWeaver Wheat, and Perpetual IPA); four seasonal releases as part of the Hop Cycle series (Cultivator Helles Bock, Sunshine Pils, Hop Knife Harvest Ale, and Blizzard of Hops Winter IPA); and two limited beers (Nugget Nectar and Mad Elf Ale). 

In addition to these beers, Tröegs produces a variety of experimental, small batch beers as part of its Scratch Beer Series. These beers are available exclusively at the brewery and most are draft-only limited releases, although some popular Scratch Beers (Fresh Hop Ale, Fest Lager, etc.) are bottled for release through the General Store at the brewery. 

In late 2013, Tröegs introduced a special line of cork & cage bottle releases. The first, LaGrave, is available year-round. Master of Pumpkins was also released in 2013 and will continue with availability in the fall. Other beers such as Jovial have since followed suit. The addition of a canning line not only offers the brewery more flexibility in the way it presents its beers, but also allows Tröegs to provide customers with more packaging options. To date, Tröegs has released Perpetual IPA and Sunshine Pils in 12-ounce cans and Troegenator in 16-ounce cans. Plans to release other seasonal and limited beers in cans are currently in the works. 

The Splinter Series is an extremely limited line of barrel-aged beers packaged in cork & cage bottles. While only a handful of these beers have been produced, Tröegs plans to expand this series with the inclusion of Nebulous (barrel-aged LaGrave with Brett), bourbon barrel-aged Troegenator, and others. 

Tröegs currently distributes its beers throughout Delaware, Massachusetts, Maryland, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Virginia and Washington D.C. In addition, Tröegs plans to expand into other New England markets in 2015.

Our state-of-the-art facility gives visitors a glimpse into the workings of a full production brewery by offering both guided tasting and self-guided tours. Our Tasting Room provides ample seating with views of the brewhouse, where you can sit back and enjoy one of our six year-round beers as well as a variety of seasonal and small-batch experimental brews. 

Our Snack Bar reflects our constant desire to explore, discover and share by focusing on fresh, simple fare that is locally sourced and house-made. With that in mind, we feature a seasonally rotating menu with daily chef’s specials.

www.troegs.com

data.name: Effinghambürgherbraü
data.description:
The Burgherbrau, our beer for the people, is a southern German-style Golden lager brewed using pale floor-malted German barley and noble hops: Hallertau, Tettnang and Saaz.
Effinghambürgherbraü is cool-fermented and cold-conditioned for a refreshing and flavorful brew, perfect for sitting in your own biergarten and enjoying throughout the year.

data.name: First Responder
data.description:
“Helles” is German for “bright,” and this beer salutes our brightest rays of hope in this sometimes dark world that put their necks on the line every day to protect us: Our Firefighters - the 'First Responders' when we need them most.

“First Responder” is probably our easiest drinking beer of all - exceptionally bright, clean, and crisp with a softness on the palate from the Dortmunder water chemistry. 

As part of our “Revolutionaries Series” Seasonal lineup, a portion of the proceeds from the sales of this brew will go directly to the Sacramento Firefighters Burns Institute, an incredible non-profit organization that supports these brave Men and Women in their time of need and the families who support them.

breweries.name: Sactown Union Brewery
breweries.description: Sactown Union Brewery is a Production Brewery with a Tasting Room located in East Sacramento, CA (just three short blocks from Sac State!). We are community oriented, and celebrate history's social catalysts - those that bucked the status quo to make the world around them a better place! "We're not just brewing Beer; We're brewing Community."

data.name: Flycaster
data.description: Named after our uncle, an avid fly fisherman, this beer is great for a hot day on the water or a refreshing quaff after a long day on the cold water before you move onto one of our Porters. Doughy, bready, Pilsner malt complimented by aroma and light flavor of German Spalt Select and Perle whirlpool hops that accent the crisp finish of this lager.

ChuckAlek Independent Brewers is pulling some of the past into the present by recovering, reviving, and recreating heritage craft brews.

breweries.name: Two Henrys Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The Two Henrys Brewing Company brews modern and traditional hand-crafted beer styles in small batches in Plant City, FL. Because local and small is just better.

With our beers we celebrate Florida’s short history and people that made our great state possible. We strive to make great beers and sneak in a Florida history lesson whether you want it or not. 

Our beers can be found at our tasting room starting on or about October 1, 2013 and select bars and restaurants in the Tampa Bay area. In the meantime, read about our coming beers and namesakes ,the Two Henrys, below…or don’t.

data.name: Gold Coin
data.description:
Light, simple and drinkable at nearly every gathering you might be lucky enough to hap upon - as long as those at the gathering consider beautiful golden goodness something worth gathering about. 

Helles is the German word for light, yet that translation does not do it justice. The Germans do not have "light" beer as we think of it in the states with low calories and lower flavor. Instead they use Helles or light do describe the golden color of this full flavored classic. This style is perhaps the most delicate of lagers. It has very little hop nose and little to no upfront bitterness. Instead it relies on sublet malt flavor and perfect balance to create its satisfying pallet.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: Münchner (Munich)-Style Helles
style.description: This beer should be perceived as having low bitterness. It is a medium-bodied, malt-emphasized beer with malt character often balanced with low levels of yeast produced sulfur compounds (character). Certain renditions of this beer style have  a perceivable level of hop flavor (note: hop flavor does not imply hop bitterness) and character but it is essentially balanced with malt character to retain its style identity. Malt character is sometimes bread-like yet always reminiscent of freshly and very lightly toasted malted barley. There should not be any caramel character. Color is light straw to golden. Fruity esters and diacetyl should not be perceived. There should be no chill haze.

breweries.name: Backpocket Brewing
breweries.description: Backpocket Beer is German-inspired and hand-crafted right here in Iowa. We strive to provide Iowans with a simple, enjoyable world-class beer.

data.name: Gold Lager
data.description: Stoudt's Gold Lager is widely recognized as one of the finest German-style beers brewed in America.  Brewed with the finest specialty malts and noble hops, this light bodied, easy drinking lager features a subtle balance of sweet malt and clean crisp hops.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

breweries.name: Stoudts Brewery
breweries.description: Over 26 years, Stoudts Brewing Company has grown and evolved from a small brewery with limited draught distribution, to a packaging regional microbrewery with distribution in 17 different states, producing over 10,000 barrels a year. Even with the growth over the years, one thing has always remained constant, and that is the attention to detail that goes into every batch of handcrafted beer that is traditionally brewed, packaged and sold with passion by our small team of hardworking dedicated employees. A tradition that was started by Ed and Carol Stoudt who both continue to spread the gospel of craft beer!

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation: Ed Stoudt's free tour: Sat. 3 pm and Sun. 1 pm

data.name: Gold Standard
data.description: An authentic German Helles lager, Gold Standard is as classic as they come. The style "Helles" refers to the light color and is often referred to as a brewery's spezial lagerbier. Bright and clear with golden color, crisp and refreshing. Mild noble hop bitterness segues into a bready malt backbone. This drinkable lager is the perfect pairing for any meal or occasion.
data.foodPairings: Salad, fish, light pork dishes, bar snacks.

breweries.name: Wolf's Ridge Brewing
breweries.description:
A family owned and operated craft brewery and restaurant, created as a result of our long and deepening love for both craft beer and food. WRB was born through the deep desire of the owners to create a gathering space for other craft beer and food lovers in the downtown Columbus community. Our goal is to build a microbrewery and restaurant that becomes a proud member of the community, where we provide our patrons with the best possible dining and drinking experience.

Our wonderful staff and team strive to offer the highest quality craft beer and a casual, comfortable restaurant environment inspired by a new American menu featuring fresh and seasonal ingredients.

breweries.name: Rocky River Brewing
breweries.description: Rocky River Brewing Company is an award-winning brewpub and restaurant located in Rocky River, Ohio. The 5,000 sq. ft. dining and pub area, styled in a turn-of-the-century architectural style, offers a casual and family-friendly dining experience for lunch, dinner or late night excitement.

data.name: Golden Helles
data.description: Golden in color, crisp, easy drinking beer for all occasions. Emphasis on malt flavors with a touch of hop to finish.

breweries.name: Von Trapp Brewing
breweries.description:
More than a decade ago Johannes von Trapp started thinking about brewing his own beer, for guests of the resort. His dream was to produce an American version of the tasty Lager he has enjoyed over the years on his trips to the countryside near his ancestral Austrian home. 

Johannes' dream became reality in the Spring of 2010, with the opening of the Trapp Family Brewery. The modest facility (60,000 or so gallons a year) is located in the lower level of the DeliBakery (formerly the Austrian Tea Room), where draughts of the heavenly concoction will be available year round.

data.name: Golden Helles Lager
data.description:
AKA The Bucket Seat Blonde
A Munich-style lager that is so clean, refreshing and beautifully brewed that it won a Gold Medal at the Great American Beer Festival.
GOLD MEDAL WINNER- 2015 Great American Beer Festival
BRONZE MEDAL WINNER- 2015 CA State Fair Beer Competition

Certain renditions of this beer style have  a perceivable level of hop flavor (note: hop flavor does not imply hop bitterness) and character but it is essentially balanced with malt character to retain its style identity. breweries.name: Garage Brewing Co.
breweries.description:
We are a state-of-the art 10 BBL brewery and fast casual restaurant in an old automotive center at the end of Old Town Front Street in Temecula. 
 
The brewery equipment was manufacured in North America by a company that has built over 350 breweries and has over 25 years of experience in the craft brewing industry. This customized equipment allows us to make truly exceptional beer with a high level of consistency. 

Equipment doesn’t begin and end in the brew house. An often-overlooked main ingredient in beer is the water. Often brewers will believe that their local water source adds to their individuality of their product, or what wine makers call terroir. While this may be true to a large extent it overlooks the importance of a beer style’s original water source when trying to replicate a specific style.  Without our Reverse Osmosis water filtration system we feel that producing a beer originating from a region with “soft” water just wouldn’t bring that beer justice, being that our own regional water is extremely hard.  Reverse Osmosis gives us flexibility and allows us to properly pay respect and more accurately replicate brewing traditions from all over the world.
 
Our brewing system also wouldn’t be complete without putting thought into the storage of our beer. Many fantastic beers leave breweries and then suffer the consequences of entering the distribution chain that wasn’t at all designed to deal with craft beer. At Garage Brewing Co, we choose our guest beer that has been handled with the utmost care, and we store our own beer just steps from where it was brewed and fermented. Our 10 BBL serving vessels ensure beer delivery in its freshest form and our draft/tap system is highly engineered to ensure that we can pour our guests a proper pint.

Many hours of thought and years of experience have been drawn from to ensure that Garage Brewing Co not only produces and serves and exceptional beer to its guests but does so in a way that respects the old world traditions.
